type_text: Essentially, there are foreign workers in Seychelles who work under a Gainful Occupation Permit (GOP). This allows the holder to be gainfully occupied in Seychelles and this could be as an employee or as a self‐employed person. Employers who want to continue employing these workers, need to notify the employment department by June 30.

description:
The Seychelles Public Health continues to reinforce these general measures to consider when travelling:
Travelers to other places should adopt the following precautions at all times: avoid crowded places and close contact with people who are unwell or showing symptoms of illness.Observe good personal hygiene. Practice frequent hand washing with soap (e.g. before handling food or eating, after going to toilet, or when hands are dirtied by respiratory secretions after coughing or sneezing). Wear a mask if you have respiratory symptoms such as a cough or runny nose. Avoid contact with live animals and consumption of raw and undercooked meats. Cover your mouth with a tissue paper when coughing or sneezing, and dispose the soiled tissue paper in the rubbish bin immediately and wash hands or use alcohol based hand sanitisers. All travelers should monitor their health closely for two weeks upon return to Seychelles and seek medical attention promptly if feeling unwell, and also inform their doctor of their travel history. If you have a fever or respiratory symptoms (e.g. cough, runny nose), you should wear a mask and call the clinic ahead of the visit.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: All countries
